results.title: The Bus trip
results.brief_description: Ever gone on a trip and thought that maybe you left the oven on at home? In this entertaining film these kinds of speculations turn a simple cross country bus trip into a nightmare. Original Format 35mm/colour.

results.title: Close to Slavery: Black Work in White History
results.brief_description: Comprehensively portrayed by the archival footage in this film is a harrowing history of a government policy forcing Aboriginal Australians to assimilate to the white definitions of education and work, mission stations, removal of Aboriginal children, forced labour often in deplorable conditions and exploitation.

group.title: Another day, another dollar: three short films about the history of work

group_siblings.title: Never Done: Women, Work and History
Projected Memories: Work in old films

results.title: Never Done: Women, Work and History
results.brief_description: ‘Never done: women, work and history’. Focuses on women in the workplace from the mid-1800s through to the 1970s including footage of the first women’s union (1882); industrialisation and factory work; the birth of the modern office worker (1890s); equal pay for equal work movement; WWI and WWII women in the workforce; trade-unionism and feminism.
results.description: ‘Never done: women, work and history’. Focuses on women in the workplace from the mid-1800s through to the 1970s including footage of the first women’s union (1882); industrialisation and factory work; the birth of the modern office worker (1890s); equal pay for equal work movement; WWI and WWII women in the workforce; trade-unionism and feminism.

results.title: Projected Memories: Work in old films
results.brief_description: ‘Projected memories: work in old films’. In 1947, a projectionist took a collection of instructional 16mm films about work to the bush. This short film includes excerpts from that collection covering early footage (1900s-1930s) of families on the land; factory workers; steel workers; coal miners; working women; the rise of trade-unions and the 8-hour day; peace campaign of 1938; the invention of the teleprinter; the arrival of the corner grocer shop and much more.

results.title: Flat is beautiful
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, black and white and audio
results.brief_description: Partly shot in Pixelvision and partly in Super 8 and using a combination of hand-drawn masks, animation and live action, this experimental film explores the theme of gender identity through the eyes of androgenous 11-year-old Taylor (Sammy Steel).
results.description: Partly shot in Pixelvision and partly in Super 8 and using a combination of hand-drawn masks, animation and live action, this experimental film explores the theme of gender identity through the eyes of androgenous 11-year-old Taylor (Sammy Steel).

results.title: The Judy spots
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, black and white and audio
results.brief_description:
‘The Judy spots’ consists of five short videos featuring a papier-mache puppet called Judy. Clever, witty and extremely dark, each of the vignettes is a social commentary about human emotions and behavior.
The vignettes are: ‘Judy feels sad’, ‘Judy hates her job’, ‘Judy has a nightmare’, ‘Judy goes to the mall’ and ‘Judy gets mad’.
